intro: Acinodendron multinerve, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple star-shaped flowers. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
